job_title: Analyst in El Paso, TX
pros: UMC offers an excellent pension and inexpensive critical care insurance.
cons:
UMC is an extremely difficult environment to thrive in… vacation is difficult to take, and is sometimes denied outright. Insurance coverage, while for critical care is generous, is only generous for benefits that can be covered at the hospital. You’ll be met with lots of exclusions elsewhere. Performance reviews are lengthy and one sided, most organizations allow you to review your management, but not here. Leadership turns a blind eye to the problems with management - lots of leaders are not familiar (at an advanced level) with the sections of the organization they are leading, which causes divisiveness and creates a very challenging culture. Technology and facilities are aging, and can cause lots of extra work. Expect long days, and an environment where it is common to be coached in public and rarely praised.

This review does not apply to any of the clinical departments at UMC with whom I have little experience.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in El Paso, TX
pros: Technicians were lovely to work with. The collaboration and bond in such a fast paced environment was extremely helpful on hectic days. Pharmacists were also so well equipped to adjust to any given situation and were always willing to assist in making the work flow. The communication within the pharmacy department with daily meetings enabled the team to react quickly and efficiently to issues, new tasks, or any areas that needed improvement.
cons:
Management was difficult to interact with. The passive aggressive nature of encounters was not productive and created more stress in an already high stakes environment. 
If any observations were made to make improvements to work flow, those observations were not taken into account. 
Both technicians and pharmacists were overworked and under appreciated.

job_title: Admitting Representative in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The benefits are great and I loved my patients. You learn so much about the community diversity.
cons: Management is horrible. 7 supervisors and you can ask all of them the same question and they all have a different  answer or don't answer the question period . If your not a favorite it's reflects on your evaluation and you will never get hired to another department or promoted to another position . The staffing is horrible I was told that it was ok I work in the emergency department alone on a holiday weekend  night when I called and asked for help. It you tell management about a problem from another department it will always be your fault. They claim to be a learning and teaching hospital, but you can't learn and teach if the info is never passed down. Only the favorites are listened to everyone else is a liar. The department is a reflection of their leadership. I worked for another goverent entity on another state. This place is a giant gossip box and of you avoid gossip your the source.

job_title: Registered Nurse in El Paso, TX
pros: Good benefits and hard working staff
cons: Poor management and don't care about patient or employee safety.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Lebanon, TN
pros: Experience even for cna. Staff is amazing. I made some wonderful friends there. Doctors are willing to explain procedures and allow you to watch in some cases. Managers are friendly and willing to help with any problems. Opprtunities to do different jobs. I myself worked as a cna, unit Secretary, and telemetry monitor tech.
cons: As a tech sometimes staffing issues cause you to be on the floor by yourself. The nurses are great and help as much as they can but obviously they have their own duties to perform. Not much recognition from management . I've been on the floor by myself several Times with many patients. I performed all duties required and still was able to help nurses and get every thing done. I was never recognized for my efforts except by the nurses I was working with.
